byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Gaia Pianigiani from Siena, Italy; Sewell Chan from London; Christopher Mele and Rick Gladstone from New York; and Rachel Donadio from Vermont.

abstract: Italian officials say death toll from 6.2 magnitude earthquake in mountain area of central Italy near Amatrice has risen to 241; survivors describe onset of quake and chaos that ensued.
lead_paragraph: Dust still swirled about the rubble piled waist-high in the town of Amatrice. Stunned survivors, some still in pajamas, wandered through the streets, unsure what to do.
snippet: Dust still swirled about the rubble piled waist-high in the town of Amatrice. Stunned survivors, some still in pajamas, wandered through the streets, unsure what to do....

headline.main: After Earthquake in Italy, ‘Half the Town No Longer Exists’
headline.print_headline: Chaos at Night: Quake in Italy Claims Scores
